intro: Pterocladis genistelloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved broom, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has narrow, opposite leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Pterocladis genistelloides is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in arid environments.
